page.title: 18Bramhope: Land Cover
page.content: The largest portion of the land cover of the Bramhope square is grassland. Approximately 40% is maintained pasture,11% enclosed rough grazing, while 18% is uncultivated non-woodland grassland.About 15% of the land is given over to growing fodder root crops for winter feed.Houses & gardens account for about 8% of the land cover, a large proportion of the square considering the population of Bramhope is 3395 people.A large recreational area called 'Golden Acre Park' incorporating cultivated gardens, woodland,rough grassland and a lake accounts for about 3% of the square.The remaining land cover consists of woodland,twice as much deciduous as coniferous and two working quarries where sandstone is extracted.
